--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Pigneri, Rocco" <rpigneri@...> wrote:
>
> De=
ar Bob,
> 
>  
> 
> You need to use both the @Test and the @Ignore annotati=
ons in order to
> get the behavior that you want.  Without the @Test annota=
tion, the test
> runner does not consider the function a test and ignores i=
t.
> 
Rocco,
Thanks for the hint. I tried it, but it didn't seem to change =
the ant
output:

$ ant unittest
[snip]
unittest:
    [junit] Running TTest
=
    [junit] Tests run: 2, Failures: 0, Errors: 0, Time elapsed: 0.103 sec

=
[Note: no indication of ignored tests, above, or in the generated HTML
repo=
rt.]

$ java -ea -cp /usr/share/java/junit4.jar:classes:test-classes
org.ju=
nit.runner.JUnitCore TTest
JUnit version 4.3.1
.I.
Time: 0.022

OK (2 tests=
)

At least the "native" runner indicates "I", which I'm assuming means
"ig=
nored". Is there any runner/formatter combination that makes this
informati=
on more explicit?
Regards,
Bob
